direction.raw_text: : A heavy, low-slung, pickup truck traveling toward the sedan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sky, freeway, the cars closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The sedan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The pickup. Like thunderous, jousting opponents, the cars pass in a deafening cacophony of noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The fat face of GREGORY, yelling at the disappearing sedan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dog of the house of Capulet moves me! He and the pimply-faced front-seat passenger, SAMPSON, explode with laughter. The red-haired driver BENVOLIO, keeps his eyes on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. The truck spirals down an exit ramp and screeches into busy driveway of a large gas station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Attendants immediately run to the truck. Two clean windshields and duco, the third fills the gas tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Gregory in the back seat is boasting outrageously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dog of that house shall move me to stand. I will take the wall of any man or maid of Capulets. Sampson, sarcastically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That shows thee a weak slave. For the weakest goes to the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Tis true; and therefore women, being the weaker vessels, are ever thrust to the wall. Therefore, I will push Capulet's men from the wall, and thrust his maids to the wall. Benvolio, disgusted, gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The quarrel is between our masters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling after him) ...and us their men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Benvolio as he heads for the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A mother wrangling three little boys out of a station wagon - the smallest kid carries a toy pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Past the mother to - the huge black sedan pulling up outside the gas station mini-mart. The front door of the sedan opens. Shiny black boots - decorated with tiny, silver, cat-shaped spurs - plant themselves on the ground. The boots are joined by two other pairs of well-shod feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The spurred boots move out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: The other feet belong to a tough-looking Latin youth ABRA - and his goateed side-kick PETRUCHIO. Abra and Petruchio enter the mini-mart, as four white-clad girls exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The girls as they head for their car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Past the girls to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Sampson is trying to out boast Gregory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will show myself a tyrant. When I have fought with the men I will be civil with the maids, I will cut off their heads. Gregory; mock outrage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The heads of the maids? Sampson leers lecherously at the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, the heads of the maids, or their maiden heads, take it in what sense thou wilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must take it in sense that feel it. Gregory and Sampson pump up the song on the sound system and sing out at the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a pretty piece of flesh! I am a pretty piece of flesh! Me, they shall feel while I am able to stand; I am a pretty piece of flesh! The girls, pretending not to notice, get into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The car pulls away revealing... Abra and Petruchio exiting the mini-mart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Gregory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson - Their singing abruptly halts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes of the House of Capulet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Abra and Petruchio stare coldly toward the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson swallowing hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Gregory; eyes locked to the Capulets. With fake bravado he nudges Sampson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quarrel I will back thee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson trying to quell his rising panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us take the law of our sides. Let them begin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BANG! Gregory and Sampson jump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It was the garage attendant slamming the hood. Gregory and Sampson are mortally embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Abra and Petruchio laugh contemptuously and move to their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The mother and kids exiting the mini-mart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Sampson furiously tries to save face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will bite my thumb at them; which is a disgrace to them if they bear it. Sampson quickly bites his thumb toward Abra's back as he gets into the sedan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Abra's eyes flick to the rear view mirror. E.C.U.: The rear view mirror; Sampson biting his thumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Suddenly, a blood curdling screech of tires - the sedan, rubber burning, reverses full speed toward Sampson and Gregory. The mother in the station wagon brakes to avoid collision - a sports car shunts into her vehicle. Mother and children scream. Attendants scatter. The Capulet car shudders to a halt inches from the truck, blocking its path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A scurry of limbs scrabbling across seats and reaching for door handles;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Abra hauls Sampson from the truck. Gregory leaps out, Petruchio covers him. Abra slams Sampson against the side of the vehicle - then, goading him to go for his gun, screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you bite your thumb at us, sir? Sampson's shaking hand hovers - ready to draw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do bite my thumb, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The panicked mother in the station wagon. She motions her children to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Customers run for cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Abra: An hysterical rage; he shrieks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you bite you thumb at us, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sweating, murmurs to Gregory) Is the law on our side if I say "Ay"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The black cowboy boots, trousers down around them. The sound of a toilet flushing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TO: The next cubicle, the door opens revealing Benvolio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson, still sweating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir, I do not bite my thumb at you, sir - but I do bite my thumb, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Gregory; a ridiculous inquiry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you quarrel, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Abra; a dangerous smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quarrel sir, no sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson; unconvincing bravado...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if you do, sir, I am for you. I serve as good a man as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Abra; a lethal question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Sampson, trapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Inside the station wagon. The mother does not notice her five year old aiming a toy gun toward the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Gregory's P.O.V.: Benvolio emerging from the bathroom - he whispers maniacally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes our kinsman. Say better!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Sampson; he screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Abra demonically roars:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Benvolio. Terror stricken, he sees the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Abra shrieks:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ABRA DRAW IF YOU BE MEN

direction.raw_text: : Four hands reaching for guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : To Benvolio - weapon outstretched he screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part, fools! You know not what you do!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; A SUPER MARCO SLAM ZOOM along the barrel of Benvolio's gun; the engraved gun type reads: 'Sword 9mm series S' CUT TO: Benvolio. He screams in desperation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put up your swords! Gregory, Sampson, Abra, and Petruchio freeze. A moment - then from behind, the unmistakable sound of a gun being cocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: The black cowboy boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: To find the dark cold eyes and feline smile, of the wearer of the boots. His name is TYBALT; a cigarette is clenched between his teeth and his gun is aimed at Benvolio's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, art thou drawn amoung these heartless hinds? Turn thee Benvolio. Benvolio, a choked explanation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do but keep the peace. A mocking smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peace? I hate the word As I hate hell, all Montagues, and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Tybalt's finger squeezing the trigger... Suddenly we hear firing from Tybalt's blind side. Tybalt redirects his weapon, cracking off a single shot at the surprise attacker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. It is the five year old from the station wagon. The bullet smacks the toy gun from the child's hand, shattering the wagon's window. Mother and children scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. A panicked Benvolio falls back, accidentally his gun fires - the bullet whistles past Tybalt's head. Tybalt combat rolls, and using a screaming car load of girls as cover, returns two quick shots, narrowly missing Benvolio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. The gas station attendant hits a button and heavy metal screens slam down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Gregory firing - a bullet rips through Abra's arm. Petruchio dives for cover; Gregory and Sampson leap into Benvolio's truck. Rubber burns as they smash past the Capulet vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Tybalt taking aim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. His first shot plugs the fuel tank, the second a tire. Out of control and spewing gasoline the Montague truck careens across the highway and through the glass front of a supermarket. Gregory and Sampson throw themselves from the truck moments before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The gas tank erupts into an almighty fireball. The screen fills with flame: the following images combust in front of us:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Citizens run in the streets. Looters raid shops near the supermarket - security guards return fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. A table of dark suited men and their wives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The powerful 60 year old face of FULGENCIO CAPULET. Seated next to him is his much younger wife GLORIA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Windows explode in a tidal wave of glass. Diners take cover. Capulet moves fearlessly toward the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to a waiter) Give me my long sword!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The word MONTAGUE fills the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We see the word is the number plate of a large black limousine. The limousine is stuck in the traffic snarl - bullets bounce off its bullet proof windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a 60 year old red-faced bulldog of a man, bursts from the back of the limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What noise is this! As Ted draws an enormous pearl handed revolver, CAROLINE, his conservatively dressed wife, tries to restrain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thou shalt not stir one foot to seek a foe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugging her off) Hold me not, let me go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Crouched behind a truck, Benvolio shakily tries to re-load.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The barrel of Tybalt's gun enters frame and presses into Benvolio's forehead. Tybalt whispers sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look upon thy death, Benvolio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Tybalt's finger on the trigger. Benvolio screams a scream of mortal horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tybalt is blinded by a burning shaft of light. A magnificently powerful helicopter gunship hovers above him. A command booms from the chopper's public address system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (over PA) Rebellious subjects, enemies to peace, Throw your mistempered weapons to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The steely gray eyes of CAPTAIN PRINCE, chief of the Verona Beach Police Department. He lifts the microphone and repeats the command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw your mistempered weapons to the ground!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Tybalt looks up to the chopper. Patrol cars screech to a halt. An almighty orchestral chord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A trail of devastation winds up through grid-locked traffic to the burning supermarket. In the distance looms an enormous statue of Christ flanked by two glass towers. We push toward the towers. One is neon-crowned MONTAGUE, the other, CAPULET. We hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two households, both alike in dignity. In fair Verona, where we lay our
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From ancient grudge break to new mutiny, Where civil blood makes civil hands unclean. From forth the fatal loins of these two foes A pair of star crossed lovers take their life. Whose misadventured piteous
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doth with their death bury their parents strife. A dark chord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. A swarm of helicopters thunder into frame. We see compressed, time-lapsed, images of their journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A coat of arms that labels a large tower - the emblem reads; "Verona Beach Police Department: In God We Trust".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Captain Prince's grim features. He eyes Capulet and Montague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three civil brawls, bred of an airy WORD By thee, old Capulet, and Montague, Have thrice disturbed the quiet of our streets. Capulet's lawyer tries to intervene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My noble Prince I can... Captain Prince overriding, slams the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If ever you disturb our streets again, Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace. Hold on Captain Prince's determined gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. A majestic sunrise; Ted Montague's limousine sulks through deserted streets. In the distance, Jesus looks out over the now peaceful city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. Ted Montague, his wife Caroline, and nephew Benvolio ride in uncomfortable silence. Caroline finally speaks her anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O where is Romeo? Saw you him today? (pointedly to Montague) Right glad I am he was not at this fray. Montague snorts derisively and stares out the window. Embarrassed, Benvolio tries to be of assistance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam, underneath The Grove of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So early walking did I see your son. Ted Montague speaks with contempt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many a morning hath he there been
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With tears augmenting the fresh morning's dew. Caroline struggles to contain her emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Away from light steals home my heavy son And private in his chamber pens himself, Shuts up his windows, locks fair daylight out And makes himself an artificial night. Montague barks into the car intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Westward from this city side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. The limousine U-turns heading west.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. To the melancholic strains of Mozart's "Serenade for Winds", we see a blond nineteen year old boy sitting alone on an empty beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The boy, ROMEO. Looking out over the ocean he sucks on the last of a cigarette and then writes intensely in a small worn note book. We hear his voice over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs; Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers' eyes; Being vexed, a sea nourished with lovers' tears. What is it else? A madness most discreet, A choking gall and a preserving sweet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. The limo is parked in a cross street that runs down to the beach. Opposite the limo, young diehard clubbers, faded drag queens and street people, hang outside a dilapidated nightclub. A broken neon sign reads: "The Grove of Sick Amore." Ted, Caroline and Benvolio sit watching the silhouette of Romeo on the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black and portentous must this humour prove Unless good counsel may the cause remove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : From the limousine. Romeo rises and listlessly makes his way up the beach - seeing his father's car he turns and heads for the path that hugs the beach front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So please you step aside. I'll know his grievance or be much denied. Benvolio clambers out of the limo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Montague, an encouraging smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come Madam. Let's away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. The limousine pulls away and Benvolio heads after Romeo. He pauses. A deck at the rear of "Sick Amore" sprawls onto the beach. At the base of the deck, Benvolio can see Romeo squatting in discussion with an old drunk. Benvolio approaches with a not very convincing casualness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morrow, cousin. Romeo turns. Sore, red, unfriendly eyes squint back at Benvolio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the day so young?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But new struck, Coz. Romeo rises, Benvolio follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay me! Sad hours seem long. Romeo stops as if taking in Benvolio for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Was that my father that went hence so fast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was. Benvolio chases Romeo down the path which divides the beach from a string of cheap souvenir shops and sleazy bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sadness lengthens Romeo's hours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not having that which having makes them short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of her favor where I am in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas that love, so gentle in his view, Should be so tyrannical and rough in proof!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas that love, whose view... Romeo is halted by the sight of last night's disturbance displayed on a small TV screen in an outdoor bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) What fray was here? Benvolio starts to reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (ANGRILY) Yet tell me not, for I have heard it all. Here's much to do with hate, but more with love. Romeo turns the corner away from the beach. He strides along the sidewalk raging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Why then, O brawling love, O loving hate, O anything, of nothing first create! O heavy lightness, serious vanity, Misshapen chaos of well-seeming forms, Feather of lead, bright smoke, cold fire, sick health, Still-waking sleep, that is not what it is! Romeo screams at a huge bouncer who lounges in the doorway of a sex club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) This love feel I, that feel no love in this! The bouncer's hand moves to his gun. Romeo, ignoring him, turns on Benvolio. A mocking laughter through tears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Dost thou not laugh? Benvolio, nervously eyeing the bouncer, shepherds Romeo out of danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, coz, I rather weep. Romeo smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell, my coz. Romeo, breaking into a jog, leaves Benvolio behind. Benvolio pursues him down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The sleeping face of a fourteen year old boy -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Balthasar sleeps on the hood of a magnificent silver car. Three or four kids doze on the sidewalk. As Romeo approaches, they jump up and begin vigorously polishing the already gleaming car. Balthasar wakes. He springs off the hood, chases the kids away, then, producing a huge bunch of keys, opens the car door for Romeo. Benvolio intercepts Romeo at the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me in sadness, who is it that you love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In sadness, cousin, I do love...a woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I aimed so near when I supposed you loved. Romeo leans against the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A right good marksman; and she's fair I love. Romeo pulls his shirt down to reveal a small shoulder tattoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The tattooed word; ROSALINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rosaline! (he is impressed) A right fair mark, fair coz, is soonest hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll not be hit with Cupid's arrow. She hath Dian's wit, And in strong proof of chastity lives well armed. Benvolio can't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she hath sworn that she will still live chaste?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hath; and in that sparing makes huge waste. Benvolio - a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be ruled by me; forget to think of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: teach me how I should forget to think! Benvolio indicates one of the working girls already strutting the foot path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By giving liberty unto thine eyes. Examine other beauties. Romeo laughs dismissively. He throws the kids a few coins and slides into the drivers seat. Balthasar jumps in back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell. Thou canst not teach me to forget.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay that doctrine, or else die in debt. Benvolio leaps into the passenger seat of the moving vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. An orchestral fanfare. TRACK DOWN: Past monstrous letters that read CAPULET and in through a window to discover Fulgencio Capulet. He stares out the window toward the other tallest building in Verona; the one crested with the word MONTAGUE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Montague is bound as well as I, In penalty alike; Capulet turns: on the other side of his desk sits DAVID PARIS; a square-jawed young man in a red cashmere sweater. Tea has been served from an exquisite silver tea service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) And 'tis not hard, I think, for me so old as we to keep the peace. Dave smiles obligingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of honorable reckoning are you both, And pity 'tis you lived at odds so long. An awkward pause: Dave sips tea, then, with a deep breath...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) But now, my lord, what say you to my suit? Capulet considers the framed photograph on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But saying o'er what I have said
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; My child is yet a stranger in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Let two more summers wither in their pride, Ere we may think her ripe to be a bride. Dave is politely insistent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Younger than she are happy mothers made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checking him hard) And too soon marred are those so early made. Earth hath swallowed all my hopes but she; She is the hopeful lady of my earth. Capulet rounds the desk and places a fatherly hand on Dave's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) But woo her, gentle Paris, get her heart. My will to her consent is but a part, And she agreed, within her scope of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lies my consent and fair according voice. This night I hold an old Accustomed feast. Capulet leans close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) At my poor house, look to behold this night, Fresh female buds that make dark heaven light. Hear all; all see, And like her most whose merit most shall be. Capulet smiles knowingly. Dave seems encouraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (a hearty slap) Come go with me! Capulet excitedly ushers Dave from the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Dim, smoke filled. Benvolio and Romeo play pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chalking his cue) Take thou some new infection to thy eye. He lines up the six ball top pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) And the rank poison of the old will die. A hopeless shot that slams the eight ball toward the side pocket. Romeo stops it with his hand and hurls it against the other balls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Romeo: his face glows pink. He is sitting on the grubby shoreline of Verona Bay dressed as a boy King Arthur, with fake chain mail and sword. Romeo watches the dying flare sink into the bay. The sound of the party drifts across the water. Balthasar, dressed as Frankenstein's monster, touches a lighter to a large bong and Romeo inhales smoke. Behind them, Benvolio, drunk and dressed as a pizza, is yelling at Gregory, who, dressed as a Viking, is trying to cut slices off his pizza costume. Sampson, also dressed as a Viking, sits in the back of a car. One arm is bandaged and he swigs from a bottle. Suddenly the darkness is slashed by headlights. A reckless sports car speeds toward the boys. Stereo screaming, the car skids to a halt.

direction.raw_text: . With a gasp, Romeo rises. A moment. His breathing calms. Then, smoothing water into his hair, he gazes into the bathroom mirror. He turns: The entire wall opposite the mirror, is a magnificent salt- water fish tank. Romeo, drawn by it's submarine beauty, leans against the fish tank. Applause echoes faintly through the bathroom speakers.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. As the music swells, Romeo watches a moustached catfish glide past a medieval castle. Suddenly, Romeo pulls away. Peering back at him through the castle is a pair of exquisitely beautiful angelic eyes. The Diva's first pure, achingly beautiful notes soar. Confused, Romeo looks again. There is no mistake - it is a girl. Through a shimmering curtain of ribbon weed, two dark wide eyes, a childish nose and sumptuous full lips. Romeo pushes his face closer to the glass. The other face snaps abruptly away.

direction.raw_text: Juliet, your mother calls. The Nurse bustles Juliet out the door. Juliet looks over her shoulder at the mystery boy.

direction.raw_text: : Juliet being dragged along by the Nurse. She glances back toward the mystery boy, but he is gone. Juliet and the Nurse rejoin Dave Paris, who is dressed as an astronaut, and Gloria, at the side of the dance floor. Dave, irresistible smile, extends his hand to Juliet.

direction.raw_text: Will you now deny to dance? Juliet looks to Dave, desperately searching for a reason to decline. Gloria, brushing aside her silly daughter's protests, slugs the last of her champagne and corrals them onto the dance floor.

direction.raw_text: What, dares the slave come hither to fleer and scorn at our solemnity? Now by the stock and honor of my

direction.raw_text: You'll make a mutiny among my guests! A middle aged couple look on shocked - Capulet waves to them

direction.raw_text: What? Cheerly my hearts! Capulet snorts at Tybalt in disgust.

direction.raw_text: You'll not endure him! Am I the master here or you? Go to. Smoothing his hair into place, Capulet turns back into the ballroom.

direction.raw_text: ON: Tybalt choking back tears of rage.

direction.raw_text: : Romeo moving through the crowd. For a moment the crush clears and he spies the Angel on the dance floor.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did my heart love till now? Forswear it, sight. For I ne'er saw true beauty till this night. Romeo begins to circumnavigate the dance floor in an attempt to get closer to Juliet.

As the crowd break into wild applause, Juliet's eyes search the darkness, but the boy is gone. The crowd cheers and screams its applause. An avalanche of balloons, tinsel and confetti rains down from the roof; swathes of red silk drop from the ceiling and the space is transformed.

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet, searching for the boy. Suddenly: A gasp, Juliet's eyes widen, shocked. In the dark, a hand has shot out from the drape curtaining off the stage and clasped hers. Juliet barely dares breathe. She glances furtively to Dave Paris - he watches the stage. Slowly Juliet turns toward the hand; there through a break in the curtain she can see eye, cheek and lips of the mystery boy. As the Diva reprises the chorus, Romeo gently pulls Juliet behind the curtain.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then, dear saint, let lips do what hands do, They pray: grant thou, lest faith turn to despair.

They join a vexed Gloria Capulet who clings to a patient Dave Paris. Inaudible words are exchanged. Juliet flickers her eyes nervously to Romeo.

direction.raw_text: She will endite him to some supper? Even more strangely, Romeo gets into the limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taken by surprise) Romeo, will you come to your father's? We'll to dinner thither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as he closes the door) I will follow you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell, ancient lady. Farewell. The car pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The limousine drives through Verona Beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOVING LIMOUSINE. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Romeo jammed into the corner of the seat. The Nurse's face is pressed alarmingly close to his. She speaks in cold deadly earnest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If ye should lead her in a fool's paradise, as they say, it were a very gross kind of behavior, as they say. For the gentlewoman is young; and therefore, if you should deal double with her, truly it were an ill thing and very weak dealing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo chooses his words carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bid her to come to confession this afternoon, And there she shall at Friar Laurence's cell Be shrived and (PUSH IN ON: Romeo) married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet's face peering out her bedroom window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God she comes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : JULIET'S P.O.V.: The limousine pulls up at the front door, the Nurse alights. Juliet bolts from the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Juliet hurries down the stairs - the Nurse, a way ahead, disappears into a doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Juliet races down a dark stairwell that leads to the bowels of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The kitchen, obviously the Nurse's domain, is decorated with a mixture of religious iconography and travel posters. Most of the posters depict a strange city of decadent, decaying, beauty. Juliet bursts breathlessly into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O honey nurse, what news? The Nurse, buried up to her ample hips inside the refrigerator, does not turn around. Juliet cries impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse! The nurse emerges from the ice box laden with food. Moving to the counter she starts to make a sandwich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am aweary, give me leave awhile. Fie, how my bones ache. What a jaunce have I. Juliet under her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would thou hadst my bones and I thy news. Juliet goes to the nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nay come, I pray thee, speak: good;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse, speak. Sandwich made, the nurse shuffles over to a corner couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesu, what haste. Can you not stay awhile? Can you not see I am out of breath? Juliet cannot stand the suspense any longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How art thou out of breath when thou hast breath To say to me that thou art out of breath! Is the news good or bad? Answer to that. The Nurse takes a big bite from her sandwich and answers through thoughtful chews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you have made a simple choice. You know not how to choose a man. Romeo? No, not he. Though his face be better than any man's, yet his leg excels all men's and for a hand and a foot and a body, though they be not to be talked on, yet they are past compare. He's not the flower of courtesy, but I'll warrant him as gentle as a lamb. Go thy ways, wench, serve God. What, have you dined at home? Juliet is flabbergasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. But all this I did know before. What says he of our marriage? What of that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord how my head aches! What a head have I: My back - This is a game that Juliet knows well. She moves behind the Nurse and begins massaging her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) o' t'other side - ah, my back! Beshrew your heart for sending me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To catch my death with jauncing up and down. With sublime self control, Juliet coo's sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'faith I am sorry that thou art not well. Sweet, sweet, sweet Nurse, tell me, what says my love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your love says like an honest gentleman, And a courteous, and a kind, and a handsome, And I warrant a virtuous - Where is your mother? Juliet cracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is my mother? How oddly thou repliest! 'Your love says, like an honest gentleman, "Where is your mother"'! The nurse sulks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God's lady dear are you so hot? Henceforth do your messages yourself. Juliet's frustration explodes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's such a coil! COME WHAT SAYS ROMEO?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Nurse considers Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got leave to go to confession today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then hie you hence to Father Laurence cell. There stays a husband to make you a wife! Juliet, with a scream of joy, hugs the Nurse to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Juliet's ecstatic features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FATHER LAURENCE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These violent delights have violent ends!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Father Laurence is preaching energetically from the pulpit. Hidden from the congregation, Romeo waits in a small alcove chapel at the side of the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) The sweetest honey Is loathsome in its own deliciousness, Therefore love moderately. The Father glances toward Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Long love doth so. Too swift arrives as tardy as too slow. Juliet pushes through the double doors at the far end of the church. Father Laurence motions to the middle-aged choir master who leads the choir into a choral version of Led Zeppelin's "A Whole Lot of Love" with Latin lyrics. Father Laurence hurries from the altar over to Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Here comes the lady. Juliet bursts into the tiny chapel. Trying to observe a vestige of decorum, she greets Father Laurence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon to my ghostly confessor. But before the priest can reply, the two lovers embrace, kissing passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo shall thank thee, daughter, for us both. The choir completes the hymn and the priest, realising it is his cue, rushes back to the altar. He quickly delivers a prayer to the congregation while eyeing the increasingly amorous smooching of the young couple. The choir launch into a joyous chorus and the priest returns to Romeo and Juliet. He delicately parts the couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Come, come, and we will make short work. For, by your leaves, you shall not stay alone Till Holy Church incorporate two in one. A young boy with a voice like Jamiroquai steps forward. He launches into a wailing solo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: A simple silver ring. Engraved on the inside of the band are the words 'I love thee.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo slips the ring onto Juliet's finger as the priest executes the formal sacrament of marriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Through the majestic patterning of stained glass, and out of the church to find Peter, the chauffeur, cradling a small camera as he waits nervously beside the limo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The music swells in celebration. Romeo and Juliet, now newly-wed, rush from the side door of the church. The priest follows, throwing handfuls of rice. Peter studiously takes a snap as the bride and groom kiss. Peter holds the door of the limousine open. Reluctantly Juliet gets into the car. As the car pulls out of the driveway, Romeo runs alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : On Romeo as he watches the big black car speed away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : From the bottom of the ocean; Mercutio's distorted features. Gun aimed, he stares intently into the water. A muffled BANG! and a bullet whizzes past the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. We see that Mercutio - wading in knee deep water close to the beach - is hunting fish. Benvolio shelters in the shade of an unmanned life guard tower. A shimmering heat haze blankets the deserted beach and the horizon is stacked with purple storm clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pray thee, good Mercutio, let's retire. The day is hot, Mercutio, ignoring him, plugs away at another fish. Benvolio nervously looks to see if there is any reaction to the sound of the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) The Capels are abroad. And if we meet we shall not 'scape a brawl. Mercutio strides out of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thou art like one of these fellows that, when he enters the confines of a tavern, claps me his sword upon the table and says 'God send me no need of thee!' (he hands Benvolio his gun) and by the operation of the second cup draws him on the drawer, when indeed there is no need. Another incredible sleight of hand routine and Mercutio has managed to draw Benvolio's pistol, retrieve his own gun, and trap Benvolio with a barrel at each temple. The joke has worn thin for Benvolio; he pushes past Mercutio toward where Balthasar, Sampson and Gregory lounge in the shade of the beach-side hang. Suddenly he stops dead - a monstrous black sedan prowls into the beach side parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By my head, here comes the Capulets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By my heel, I care not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The sedan mounts the curb and slides to a halt only metres from Benvolio and Mercutio. Tybalt, Abra and Petruchio alight from the sedan and walk menacingly toward Mercutio and Benvolio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, good day. A word with one of you. The boys from the hang, drawn the Capulet car, converge - eyes dart nervously, hands stray towards guns. Mercutio smiles mockingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And but one word with one of us? Couple it with something. Make it a word and a... Leaning close to Tybalt, he camps the implication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) ...blow. Mercutio scores. The boys laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shall find me apt enough to that, sir, (clutching at his side arm) And you will give me occasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Mercutio. He stops, eyeing the hand on the gun. No one moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a breathy, coquettish
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Could you not take some occasion without giving? The boys fall about again. Tybalt cracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercutio, thou consortest with Romeo. The accusation stings - Mercutio's anger flares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consort? What, dost thou make us minstrels? And thou make minstrels of us look to hear nothing but discords. Here's my fiddlestick. Indicating his holstered gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Here's that shall make you dance. (barking at Tybalt) Zounds, (goading him to go for his gun) consort!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Tybalt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Mercutio. He will not back down. Benvolio tries to diffuse things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either withdraw unto some private place. Or reason coldly of your grievances. Here all eyes gaze on us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men's eyes were made to look, and let them gaze. I will not budge for no man's pleasure, I. At that moment, Romeo's car pulls into the lot. Tybalt smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well sir, here comes my man. Tybalt moves toward Romeo who bounds from his car full of happy news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo, the love I bear thee can
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No better term than this:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Tybalt. He clears his jacket from his side arm and issues the challenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Thou art a villain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Mercutio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Benvolio. All eyes are on Romeo. Romeo calmly approaches his now cousin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tybalt, the reason that I have to love thee Doth much excuse the appertaining
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To such a greeting: villain am I none, Therefore farewell. I see thou knowest me not. Romeo turns, and to the amazement of all, walks back to his car. Tybalt, unable to shoot him in the back, is confused. He hurls himself into his sedan. Kicking it into a sand spraying U-turn, he careens the short distance to Romeo's car. Slamming into the back of it he blocks Romeo in. Tybalt leaps out, maniacally kicking at bumper, door and headlights. Romeo flicks the locks down. Tybalt shatters the side window and hauls Romeo through the door, slamming him against the savaged fuselage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, this shall not excuse the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That thou hast done me! He smashes Romeo across the face, Romeo crashes to the roadway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn and draw. A cut has opened in the side of Romeo's mouth. He unsteadily lifts himself up, and meeting Tybalt's gaze, speaks through bloodied teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never injured thee, And so, good Capulet, which name I TENDER As dearly as mine own... Romeo cautiously extracts his gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) ...be satisfied. ...and throws it at Tybalt's feet. Storm clouds obscure the sun as Romeo turns and walks from the parking lot. Mercutio, Benvolio and the others cannot believe their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O calm, dishonourable, vile submission!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Tybalt's anger must be answered. He ceremoniously disarms, gives his weapon to Abra, and sprints after Romeo who is now passing a beach side lot that houses an abandoned grand hotel. A bone-cracking kick sends Romeo crumbling into the vacant lot. The boys swarm toward the fray. Romeo, still refusing the fight, scrambles up the stairs of the deserted hotel. Tybalt trips him and Romeo careens into an ornamental wooden railing, smashing it to pieces. Tybalt kicks savagely at the helpless Romeo. Suddenly, Mercutio appears running full tilt down the concrete terrace. He plucks up one of the splintered wooden palings and yells...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Tybalt, you ratcatcher, ...as he bludgeons him across the face. Tybalt goes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Will you walk? Tybalt leaps to his feet grabbing a lump of wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What wouldst thou have with me? He swipes at Mercutio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good King of Cats, nothing but one of your nine lives. Mercutio jabs, Tybalt sidesteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am for you. Tybalt aims a double-handed blow to Mercutio's head. Mercutio blocks, hooking Tybalt's stick away. Unarmed, Tybalt throws his full body weight upon Mercutio, slamming him against a window that shatters in a storm of glass. Lightning fast, Mercutio jackknifes to his feet. He raises his weapon to deliver a skull-crushing final blow to the trapped Tybalt. Romeo rushes between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forbear this outrage, good Mercutio! Seizing the opportunity, Tybalt lunges at Romeo with a lethal triangle of broken glass. He misses, gouging instead a slash of flesh from Mercutio's stomach. A scream of excruciating pain as Mercutio grabs at his bloodied side. Everyone is still. In the abrupt silence, sirens are heard closing in the distance. Abra tugs at Tybalt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Away Tybalt! They bolt for their vehicle. Benvolio goes to Mercutio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Art thou hurt? But Mercutio, covering his wound with his hand, laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, ay, a scratch. He turns to his assembled fans at the bottom of the stairs. With outrageous bravado he plays at being Caesar the conqueror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A scratch! The boys cheer their conquering hero. Romeo helps Mercutio down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Courage, man. The hurt cannot be much. Mercutio holding his bleeding side, jokes through the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Twill serve. Ask for me tomorrow and you shall find me a grave man. He turns the next thought to the assembled audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (through crazy laughter) A plague o' both your houses! Mercutio turns from the cheering boys to Romeo who is struggling to support his weight. Mercutio - through weak and desperate breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Why the devil came you between us? I was hurt under your arm. Romeo starts to register the panic in Mercutio's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought all for the best. Like an animal trying to break free from a mortal trap, Mercutio pushes Romeo away. He screams in horror, as if falling in the dark:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A plague o' both your houses! They have made worms' meat of me. Mercutio staggers down the stairs and collapses in the dirt. Romeo is there instantly, cradling his friend's head out of the dust. The dying boy stares back at Romeo, smiling through the chilling cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (a silent whisper) Your houses! Everything stands still, everything is quiet. The storm finally breaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Tiny drops of water fall from the sky and bespeckle Mercutio's lifeless body. The droplets grow to a heavy rain. Romeo can hear the faint sound a thousand miles away of Benvolio whispering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercutio is dead! Tears streak Romeo's face. He cries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sweet Juliet, Thy beauty hath made me effeminate And in my temper softened valor's steel! The sound of Tybalt's vehicle starting brings back cold reality. Romeo's sorrow turns to uncontrollable rage. Shrugging aside Benvolio's attempts to restrain him, Romeo runs to his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Up ahead Tybalt's sedan screeches into a fishtailing U-turn and powers away. Romeo jumps into his vehicle. In an effort to head Tybalt off, he guns his damaged machine down a one way street. The rain is now blinding. Romeo stops for nothing; pedestrians flee, cars spin out of control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The two cars speed along parallel roads toward Plaza Jesu. Romeo is gaining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tybalt's car negotiating the immense roundabout at the foot of the statue of Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo's car firing out of the one way street and slamming into Tybalt's car. Tybalt's car careens out of control up the stairs of the statue, clips the fountain, flips, and slides upside down onto the roadway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tybalt scrambling from his upturned vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo running toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo is halted by Tybalt's drawn gun. Fearlessly marching toward it, he screams through tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercutio's soul Is but a little way above our heads, Romeo grabs the barrel of the gun; forcing it between his own eyes, he growls insanely at Tybalt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Staying for thine to keep him company. Tybalt, unnerved, tries to back off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thou, wretched boy, shalt with him hence. Romeo, refusing to let go of the gun, forces Tybalt backward through the torrential rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with frightening intensity) Either thou or I, or both, must go with him. Cars swerve, Romeo is relentless. He grips Tybalt's hand trying to force him to shoot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Either thou or I, or both, must go with him. Panicked, Tybalt wrenches free and lurches onto the roadway. Blinded by the headlights of an oncoming car he thuds onto its hood as it skids to a halt. The impact catapults his gun high into the air. Romeo coldly follows its slow motion, spinning trajectory. Real time stretches as the gun dances high above his head. Police sirens, cars swerving, people screaming, and the yelling of panicked commands fade to a nothingness. Romeo stands calmly considering the gun in the air. A harrowing symphonic tone and the echo of Mercutio's voice can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the devil came you between us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Patrol cars sliding to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The spinning gun slowly falling to earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tybalt rising from the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Cops leaping from their cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The gun landing in Romeo's hand. His eyes full of rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Cops levelling their revolvers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Romeo in his sights) Put up thy weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Real time - Romeo fires three deliberate shots. Tybalt's body convulses backwards against the car, hitting it with a thud, bloodying the shattered windscreen. The cop fires. A bullet grazes Romeo's arm - his gun drops as he screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am fortune's fool! At that moment a roaring hurricane wind hits; blinding police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The scaffolding surrounding the Jesus statue. Part of it's canvas covering rips away. Scaffold rains down as the insanely flapping material tries to smash free from it's moorings. Through the mayhem, a rusty Ford driven by Balthasar, slides to a halt. Balthasar screams out at Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo, away be gone! Stand not amazed! Romeo collapses into the front seat. The cops open fire as Balthasar speeds off into the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Romeo is bleeding from the bullet graze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. The gale-force winds throw waves across the causeway as the fugitives disappear into the black afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: In the distance we see Montague and Capulet towers. Divided by the statue of Christ, they suffer the storm's rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Away, below the outstretched arms of Christ, lights from emergency vehicles pulse red through the downpour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Falls through heavy rain toward a woman crouched over the lifeless body of Tybalt. She cries:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tybalt! Cops nervously eye Fulgencio Capulet and Ted Montague, who, both flanked by body guards, face each other across the crime scene. Medics stand by helplessly as Gloria clings to Tybalt's body. A handcuffed Benvolio looks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Tybalt, my cousin, O my brother's child!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the blood is spilled of my dear kinsman. Police lines part as Captain Prince arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the vile beginners of this fray? Benvolio struggles forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O noble Prince I can discover all The unlucky manage of this fatal brawl. Gloria appeals hysterically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince as thou art true, For blood of ours shed blood of Montague!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benvolio, who began this bloody fray?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to Tybalt's corpse) There lies the man, slain by young Romeo, That slew thy kinsman brave Mercutio. Gloria interjects savagely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He speaks not true! Affection makes him false!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo, that spoke him fair, could not take Truce with the unruly spleen of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deaf to peace!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a kinsman to the Montague! I beg for justice which thou Prince must give. Romeo slew Tybalt, Romeo must not live! Captain Prince turns to Gloria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo slew him, he slew Mercutio. Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe? Ted Montague pleads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not Romeo, Prince, he was Mercutio's friend; His fault concludes but what the law should end, The life of Tybalt. Captain Prince eyes Montague coldly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And for that offence Immediately we do exile him. Montague, body guards in tow, surges forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noble Prince...? Prince silences him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will be deaf to pleading and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Nor tears nor prayers shall purchase out abuses. Therefore use none. The Captain turns and addresses his assembled officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Let Romeo hence in haste, Else, when he is found that hour is his last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Captain Prince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Bear hence this body and attend our will. Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. An acoustic guitar version of Joy Division's 'Love Will Tear Us Apart.' Juliet traces the path of a raindrop on the window pane as she speaks her thoughts to the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come gentle night, coming loving black browed night, Give me my Romeo. And when I shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night, And pay no worship to the garish sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not possessed it, and though I am sold, Not yet enjoyed. So tedious is this day As is the night before some festival To an impatient child that hath new

direction.raw_text: : Of the window and CRANE DOWN: Juliet runs from the room.
