direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. Through the open doorway we see an excited Juliet meet the Nurse at the bottom of the stairs. The music surges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Nurse's words are lost in the storm. Juliet buckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AFTERNOON. We are close enough now to hear Juliet's words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! Did Romeo's hand shed Tybalt's blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It did, it did! Alas the day, it did!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh serpent heart, hid with a flowering face. Was ever book containing such vile
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So fairly bound? O, that deceit should dwell In such a gorgeous palace!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no trust, No faith, no honesty in men. All perjured, All forsworn, all naught, all dissemblers. Shame come to Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blistered be thy tongue For such a wish! He was not born to shame. Upon his brow shame is ashamed to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you speak well of him that killed your cousin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall I speak ill of him that is my husband? Ah, poor my lord, what tongue shall smooth thy name When I, thy three-hours wife have mangled it? But whyfore, villain, didst thou kill my cousin? That villain cousin would have killed my husband. All this is comfort, wherefore weep I then? Some word there was worser than Tybalt's death: I would forget it fain - exiled. Tybalt is dead, and Romeo exiled. To speak that word is father, mother, Tybalt, Romeo, Juliet, all slain, All dead. Juliet sinks to the floor, overwhelmed by tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Nurse, I'll to my wedding bed, And death, not Romeo, take my maidenhead. Nurse looks down at Juliet. She goes and comforts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hie to your chamber. I'll find
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To comfort you. I know well where he is. Hark ye, your Romeo will be here at night. Juliet looks up through tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O find him, give this ring to my true knight, And bid him come to take his last farewell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Into the ring. The screen fills with the words 'I love thee'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Romeo lies on the bed shirtless and crying. His wound has been bandaged and Balthasar crouches frightened in the corner. The priest leads the Nurse into the room. Romeo looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse! She goes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah sir! Ah sir! Death's the end of all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speakest thou of Juliet? Where is she? And how doth she? And what says My concealed lady to our cancelled love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: she says nothing, sir, but weeps and weeps, And then on Romeo cries, and then falls down again. Romeo is wailing inconsolably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if that name, Shot from the deadly level of a gun, Did murder her, as that name's cursed hand murdered her kinsman! Father Laurence shakes the hysterical boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought thy disposition better tempered! Thy Juliet is alive, There art thou happy. The law that threatened death becomes thy friend And turns it to exile. There art thou happy. A pack of blessings light upon thy back. Romeo calms. The Nurse gives him the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here sir, a ring my lady bid me give you. Romeo enfolds the ring in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How well my comfort is revived by this. The priest goes to his wardrobe, removes a clean white shirt and helps Romeo put it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go, get thee to thy love, as was decreed. Ascend her chamber. Hence and comfort her. But look thou stay not till the Watch be set, For then thou canst not pass to Mantua where thou shalt live till we can find a time To blaze your marriage, reconcile your friends, Beg pardon of the Prince and call thee back, With twenty hundred thousand times more joy Than thou wentst forth in lamentation. Father Laurence ushers Romeo from the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. They hurry down the hallway. The priest opens the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go hence. Be gone by the break of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sojourn in Mantua. Give me thy hand. Romeo embraces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell. The priest and Balthasar watch as Romeo and the Nurse sprint for the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Sobs echo through the house. Dave Paris stands in the entrance hallway clutching a huge bunch of flowers. Fulgencio Capulet stands beside him, whisky glass in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Gloria on the upper landing. There is a strange faraway quality about her as she descends to Dave and Capulet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll not come down tonight. Dave, an understanding smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These times of woe afford no times to woo. Capulet guides Dave into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look you, she loved her kinsman Tybalt dearly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so did I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a cold glance at Gloria) Well, we were born to die. Capulet takes a large slug of whisky. Gloria leans close to Dave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll know her mind early tomorrow. Tonight she's mewed up to her heaviness. As Gloria, Dave and Capulet exit down the hallway we CRANE UP: toward Juliet's bedroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet's face. Tears stream onto the pillow. Without warning a hand lightly touches her cheek. Juliet's eyes dart up to discover Romeo standing above her. A still moment of disbelief. Leaning down, Roemo kisses away the tears that fall from her dark, wide eyes. Juliet's lips find Romeo's and they gently sink back onto the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Capulet sits in an armchair drinking. Dave and Gloria sit opposite as Capulet whips himself into a frenzy of drunken excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll keep no great ado - a friend or two. For, hark you, Tybalt being slain so late, It may be thought we held him carelessly, Being our kinsman if we revel much - But soft what day is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monday my lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Wednesday is too soon - what say you to Thursday? Gloria looks up alarmed; Dave is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lord I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaning close) I will make a desperate tender of my child's love. (a drunken good humour) I think she will be ruled in all respects by me; (exploding with hearty laughter) Nay, more, I doubt it not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Gloria, her face hardens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Dave) But what say you to Thursday? Dave is trying to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lord I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Capulet he eyes Dave intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I would that Thursday were tomorrow. Delighted, Capulet jumps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thursday let it be then! Capulet holds out his glass in toast. Dave and Gloria rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wife, go you to Juliet ere you go to bed. Tell her, a Thursday she shall be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To this noble sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The glasses clink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. A pink and gold dawn breaks over Capulet Mansion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. A tangle of young limbs. Romeo and Juliet blissfully asleep. The dawn light creeps into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. Balthasar's car covertly pulls into a side road near the estate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. Romeo and Juliet still asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: Toward the sleeping innocence of the faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A shadow of fear passes across Romeo's features. With a cry of panic, he sits bolt upright. Wide awake, but disorientated, Romeo stares around the room - as Juliet stirs, he remembers where he is. Slipping quietly from the bed, Romeo begins to dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Romeo. A pair of lips enter frame and find his neck. It is Juliet. She hugs herself to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilt thou be gone? It is not yet near day. Romeo turns - softly he strokes her cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must be gone and live, or stay and die. Juliet kisses his finger-tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yond light is not daylight, And then his cheek...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I know it, I It is some meteor that the sun
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To light thee on thy way to Mantua. Therefore stay yet. Thou needest not to be gone. Romeo, feverishly returning the kisses, throws himself on Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me be taken, let me be put to death. I have more care to stay than will to go. Come, death, and welcome! Juliet wills it so. Juliet is suddenly still. Romeo kisses her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) How is't, my soul? Let's talk. It is not day. Juliet pulls Romeo to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is, it is! Hie hence, be gone, away!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now be gone! More light and light it grows. Frantically she helps him into his clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More light and light: more dark and dark our woes. There is an urgent knocking on the door. They freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your lady mother is coming to your chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, window, let day in, and let life out. Desperately Juliet pulls Romeo out onto the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. The storm, now past, has left a morning achingly pure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell, farewell. One kiss, and I'll descend. Romeo climbs down from the balcony and into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: think'st thou we shall ever meet again? Romeo smiles up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it not; Juliet's face darkens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I have an ill-divining soul. Methinks I see thee, now thou art so low, As one dead in the bottom of a tomb. Romeo scrambles back up to the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, love, all these woes shall serve For sweet discourses in our times to come. From Juliet's bedroom comes the brittle sound of Gloria Capulet's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ho daughter! Are you up? Juliet spins around. Gloria has parted the curtains and is staring directly at her daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo sheltered just below the lip of the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : His hand, as it slowly reaches up and touches Juliet's fingers hidden behind her back. Gloria returns to the room. Juliet steals a glance toward Romeo as he silently mouths:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adieu, adieu! As Romeo's face disappears into the shadows Juliet whispers a little prayer to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fortune, Fortune! Be fickle, Fortune, Fo then I hope thou wilt not keep him long But send him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. Juliet is trying not to cry as she goes in to her mother. Gloria turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thou hast a careful father, child: One who, to put thee from thy heaviness, Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy That thou expects not nor I looked not for. Juliet plays along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam, in happy time. What day is that? Gloria takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marry, my child, early next Thursday
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gallant, young, and noble gentleman, Sir Paris, at Saint Peter's Church, Shall happily make thee there a joyful bride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet. She can barely speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now by Saint Peter's Church, and Peter too, He shall not make me there a joyful bride! Fear passes across Gloria's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes your father. Tell him so yourself. Capulet - whisky glass in hand - ebulliently bursts into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How now, wife? Have you delivered to her our decree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, sir. But she will none, she gives you thanks. I would the fool were married to her grave! Capulet - a dangerous calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Will she none? Is she not proud? Doth she not count her blest, Unworthy as she is, that we have
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So worthy a gentleman to be her bride?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not proud you have, but thankful that you have. Proud can I never be of what I hate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Capulet considers his daughter, then -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He hurls his glass against the wall, shattering it into a thousand pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank me no thankings, nor proud me no prouds, But fettle your fine joints 'gainst Thursday next ... Capulet advances. Juliet, terrified, retreats into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear me with patience but to speak a word...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The Nurse appears as Capulet picks his daughter up and shakes her like a rag doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak not, reply not, do not answer me! He throws her to the floor. His fist thuds as it slams into her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fie, fie! What are you mad? Gloria tries to restrain Capulet. He back-hands her, sending her flying against the wall - bellowing insanely, he advances on his cowering daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang thee, young baggage! Disobedient wretch. The Nurse throws herself between Capulet and Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God in heaven bless her! You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so. Furious, Capulet shunts her aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peace, you mumbling fool! Capulet yanks his daughter's face close to his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I tell thee what - get thee to church a Thursday Or never after look me in the face. And you be mine, I'll give you to my friend. And you be not, hang, beg, starve, die in the streets, Trust to it. Bethink you. I'll not be forsworn. Capulet storms off down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet. She huddles, shaking at the top of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O sweet my mother, cast me not away! Delay this marriage for a month, a week. Or if you do not, make the bridal
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In that dim monument where Tybalt lies. A trickle of blood issues from Gloria's cut lip. She checks her appearance in the hall mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk not to me, for I'll not speak a word. Do as thou wilt, for I have done with thee. Gloria leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God! - O Nurse, how shall this be prevented? The Nurse doesn't reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) What sayest thou? Hast thou not a word of joy? Some comfort, Nurse. A heavy silence. The Nurse goes to Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faith, here it is. I think it best you married with this Paris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he's a lovely gentleman! I think you are happy in this second match, For it excels your first; or if it did not, Your first is dead - or 'twere as good he were As living here and you no use of him. Juliet is very still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speakest thou from thy heart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And from my soul too. Else beshrew them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Juliet is matter of fact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thou hast comforted me marvellous much. Go in; and tell my lady I am gone, Having displeased my father, to Friar Laurence, To make confession and to be absolved. The old woman nods. She strokes Juliet's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is wisely done. Juliet does not look up. A disturbing choral chant:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Sunlight pierces stained glass - the chant a sinister underscoring. We hear Dave Paris' voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: Father Laurence and Dave Paris stand at the front of the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) ...Now, sir, her father counts it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That she doth give her sorrow so much sway, And in his wisdom hastes our
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To stop the inundation of her tears... Father Laurence turns. Juliet stands framed in the white glare of the doorway. Dave smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happily met, my lady and my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet's hand concealed beneath her coat - we can just see the handle of a gun. Juliet advances slowly, an icy calm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That may be, sir, when I may be a wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That 'may be', must be, love, on Thursday next. Juliet stares past Dave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What must be, shall be. Father Laurence, a forced cheerfulness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a certain text.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come you to make confession? Juliet forces a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you at leisure, holy father, now? Or shall I come to you at evening mass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My leisure serves me, pensive daughter, now. (to Dave) We must entreat the time alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God shield I should disturb devotion! - Juliet, on Thursday early will I rouse ye; Dave bends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Juliet; she stares stonily ahead as Dave kisses her cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Till then, adieu, and keep this holy kiss. Dave leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Juliet; she runs for the sacristy. The priest follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Juliet, shaking with sobs takes refuge in the shadows of the small room. The priest goes to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juliet, I already know thy grief. Juliet pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me not, Father, that thou hearest of this, Unless thou tell me how I may prevent it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It strains me past the compass of my wits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If in thy wisdom thou canst give no
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do thou but call my resolution wise, And with this I'll help it presently! She pulls the gun, pointing it towards herself. Horrified, Father Laurence moves to her. Juliet, panicked, levels the gun at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold daughter!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through tears) Be not so long to speak. I lone to die! Father Laurence holds out a soothing hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do spy a kind of hope, Which craves as desperate an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As that is desperate which we would prevent. If, rather than marry Paris, Thou hast the strength of will to slay thyself, Then it is likely thou wilt
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thing like death... We hear the distended chords of Faure's Requiem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) to chide away this shame... It continues throughout as; The entire screen fills with a glinting tear drop of blue liquid. Reflected in the fluid's convex surface, the face of Father Laurence. The face disappears as the tear drop falls and splashes into a clear water solution. Like a comet in slow motion, the drop stains the water a cobalt hue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The blue liquid fills a tiny glass vial held by Father Laurence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) No warmth, no breath shall testify thou livest. Each part, deprived of supple government, Shall stiff and stark and cold appear, like death. Now when the bridegroom in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes to rouse thee from thy bed, there art thou, dead. Thou shalt be borne to that same ancient vault Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie. In the meantime, against thou shalt awake, Shall Romeo by my letters know our drift, And hither shall he come. And that very Night shall Romeo bear thee hence to Mantua. The priest cautiously hands Juliet the vial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Take thou this vial, being then in bed, And this distilling liquor drink thou off. I'll send my letters to thy lord with speed to Mantua.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. As Father Laurence speaks, the screen fills with an express envelope addressed "Romeo - Mantua." The envelope pulls away from the camera and falls into a canvas bag brimming with hundreds of like envelopes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : With the canvas bag. It continues its journey into the back of an express delivery van. Heavy double doors slam shut, filling the screen with the slogan 'Speed Express.' The van pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. A burning red sun is setting over an endless vista of ragged wasteland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: A weathered sign reads - Mantua: Behind it a vast colony of permanent trailer homes stretches into the distance. The rap, rap, rap of knocking echoes through the park...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The source of the knocking. An express delivery man, envelope in hand, raps vigorously on the door of an unremarkable trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo lies flat on a single bed in the crampled trailer. The rap, rap, rap is very loud now. We move toward Romeo and realise he cannot hear the knocking because he has Walkman headphones on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Unsuccessful, the delivery man is filling out a "WE CALLED" card. He pushes it under the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. The heraldic 'Wedding Chimes' by JS Bach. Juliet stands resplendent in a radiant bridal gown. The image floats ethereally in a towering slab of mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : From the mirror. The wedding dress is in fact being held in front of Juliet by two members of the house staff. Juliet is dressed in her night gown. The Nurse suggests various pairs of shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, these attires are best. The fuss dispensed with, the staff leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, gentle Nurse, I pray thee leave me to myself tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Bride? Juliet navigates the Nurse toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost in tears) To move the heavens to smile upon my state, Which, well thou knowest, is cross and full of sin. Juliet holds the Nurse in a pleading stare. She leaves. Alone now, Juliet hurries to her bedside drawer. She cautiously removes a rolled piece of cloth from which she produces the glass vial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if this mixture do not work at all? Shall I be married then tomorrow morning? She cautiously begins to unscrew the tiny black lid. Suddenly, a knock at her door. Palming the vial, Juliet swings around to meet the arrival of her mother. Gloria probes her daughter's uneasiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, are you busy, ho? Need you my help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (makes light of it) No, madam. We have culled such
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As are behoveful for our state tomorrow. So please you, let me now be left alone, And let the Nurse this night sit up with you. Juliet begins to pull down the covers on her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) For I am sure you have your hands full all In this so sudden business. Gloria, sensing Juliet's distress, moves cautiously toward her. Taking hold of the bed covers she helps her daughter into bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Juliet slides into bed. Gloria covers her with the blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Get thee to bed, and rest, for thou hast need. A brief moment between mother and daughter. Gloria, unable to cross that final barrier, moves to the door; but she is stopped by the urgency in Juliet's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farewell! Gloria turns to Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) God knows when we shall meet again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Gloria. A faint perplexity, and then with an almost warm smile she turns out the light and leaves. The room is in darkness but for patterns of moonlight through windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Toward Juliet. The sombre tones of Faure's Requiem seep into our consciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins That almost freezes up the heat of life. She brings the vial her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Come, vial. Romeo, I drink to thee. Juliet drinks, a sudden violent convulsion, her face contorts in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The sky is filled with green and grey clouds. A gusty rain blows the flower arrangements across the lawn. Large white wedding marquees flap in the wind. Through blurring rain, we see ambulances and police vehicles, lights flashing. Father Laurence, accompanied by a dour looking man in black, alights from his car. We follow their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We hear snatches of radio calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortal drugs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of lethal quantity as 'twould render death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. They enter the house and pass the vast dining room, bedecked with wedding decorations. Capulet sits at the large mahogany table. In the background Gloria stares vacantly. Moving swiftly toward a doorway, the music builds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. The door opens. On the bed Juliet's still body. Father Laurence closes the door. The priest kneels and hastily examines Juliet's pupils. He looks to the man in black who retrieves the glass vial from the floor and pockets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the man in black) As the custom is, In all her best array bear her to church. When the man in black allows two other dark suited men into the room, it becomes clear he is the undertaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shall be borne to that same ancient vault Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. A thousand voices proclaim the 'Song of Ascension.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: From the vaulting glass ceiling of the Capulet mausoleum. On view, enshrined in literally thousands of lit candles, is Juliet's peaceful body. We move through lines of Capulet mourners. In the shadows of the front door a young man hides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The young man. We recognise the distressed face of Balthasar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Balthasar rushes from the Mausoleum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. We are high above Mantua. Beyond the trailer park stretches a long ribbon of black highway. As a Speed Express van turns off the highway and into the park, we hear Romeo's voice over:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep My dreams presage some joyful news at hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: The Express van pulls up at the front office. The driver alights and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Romeo sits at the trailer's small kitchen table smoking and writing in his notebook. The "WE CALLED" card lies next to an overflowing ashtray. His voice over continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And all this day an unaccustomed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts. I dreamt my lady came and found me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And breathed such life with kisses in my lips That I revived and was an emperor. Ah me, how sweet is love itself
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When but love's shadows are so rich in joy. Stubbing out his cigarette, Romeo gazes through the trailer window to see Balthasar's speeding car turn off the highway and into the trailer park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: News from Verona! An excited Romeo rushes from the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HIGH: Romeo sprints across open ground to intercept Balthasar's car. We see, but Romeo cannot, the Express van approaching from the office. The car slews to a halt and Balthasar jumps out. Romeo yells joyously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How now, Balthasar? Bathlasar cannot speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Dost thou not bring me letters from the Priest? How doth my lady? Is my father well? How doth my lady Juliet? That I ask again, For nothing can be ill if she be well. Balthasar does not know how to say what he has come to tell. He looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she is well and nothing can be ill. Her body sleeps in Capels' monument, And her immortal part with angels lives. I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault. For a long moment Romeo is profoundly still. When he speaks, it is with a chilling calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it e'en so? Balthasar nods. Romeo turns and stares into the distant wasteland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: He speaks with bitter determination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I defy you stars. Romeo moves to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will hence tonight. Balthasar tries to restrain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have patience... Exploding with fury, Romeo throws Balthasar against the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Speed Express messenger. Returning to his truck, the priest's undelivered envelope in his hand, the messenger looks toward the two boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The boys. Balthasar pleads with Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your looks are pale and wild and do
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some misadventure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with cold serenity) Tush, thou art deceived. (a niggling thought) Hast thou no letters to me from the Priest? Balthasar shakes his head. Romeo smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter - I will hence tonight. Romeo climbs into the passenger seat of the car. Balthasar reluctantly gets behind the wheel. As silent tears begin to flow, Romeo turns his face to the setting sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : As he whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Juliet, I will lie with thee tonight. Balthasar's car roars out of the park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The delivery man. He looks to the envelope in his hand, then gets back into his truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Balthasar's car speeds along the night-time highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: In the distance the glow of city lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Balthasar's car pulls into an alley and stops outside a decrepity apartment block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A bespectacled eye peers through the crack of a partly open doorway. Below the face, the barrel of a shotgun protrudes menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo in the dark, paint peeling hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me have A dram of poison, such soon- speeding gear As will disperse itself through all the veins That the life-weary taker may fall dead. The eye considers, a voice rasps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such mortal drugs I have, but Verona's law Is death to any he that utters them. Romeo speaks with fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world is not thy friend, nor the world's law. Then be not poor, but break it and take this. Romeo shoves a wad of money at THE APOTHECARY'S face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The rattle of a latch chain and the door swings open. Standing in the doorway is The Apothecary. Sixty something, he has a face scarred with age and abuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My poverty, but not my will consents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pay thy poverty and not thy will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Father Laurence. He speaks into the telephone with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who bore my letter then to Romeo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. A bored clerk is on the other end of the line. The priest's letter is on the counter beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could not sent it - here it is again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Father Laurence is worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By my brotherhood, unhappy fortune! The letter was of dear import. (PAUSE: the priest listens) Adieu. He hangs up the receiver and looks at the wall clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Now must I to the monument alone. Within this hour will fair Juliet awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The clock to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A cat skitters across a stained formica table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Apothecary's apartment is filled with cats. Dozens of feline eyes glow in the dim room. Romeo stands nervously. The Apothecary extracts a small chemist's vial from inside a 'Statue of Our Lady' table lamp - he now speaks with cool professionalism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink it off and if you had the strength of twenty men it would dispatch you straight. Romeo takes the vial and hands over the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is my gold - worse poison to men's souls Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Motor running, Balthasar waits in the alley outside the apartment building. He checks the rear view mirror and freezes. At the end of the alleyway a police car crawls to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Romeo exits the building, and as he does so, the streetlight catches his face. The Cop's and Romeo's eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is that banished haughty Montague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Balthasar cracks; he guns the engine and the car lurches forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Tires screech as Romeo dives into the passenger seat of Balthasar's moving vehicle. Siren blaring, the police car gives chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Balthasar's car winds through traffic - the patrol car gaining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. A police car U-turns over a median strip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A rusted brown hood. The tortured engine screams as Balthasar negotiates the speeding car through city traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP: Red and blue police light approach fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Captain Prince barrels through the corridors of police headquarters pulling on his flying jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A smoking tire as it lays rubber to the asphalt. Balthasar grits his teeth as he weaves the car through the impossibly tight space between a container truck and a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The patrol car is almost upon them when... in a seemingly suicidal manoeuvre Balthasar throws his car into a right-angle turn across four lanes of oncoming traffic. Horns blare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A skidding, squealing, out of control sedan, braking to avoid collision. Miraculously, Balthasar's vehicle shoots out of it its path and onto the other side of the roadway. The sedan slams into the following patrol car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Balthasar's car speeds into the driveway of the Verona Beach Eternal Rest Cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Captain Prince scans the night time city below. He speaks to the pilot and the chopper banks sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A stone angel etched against the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: Romeo pulls a crowbar from the trunk of the parked car. Police sirens sound in the distance. Romeo eyes Balthasar intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upon thy life, whatever thou
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or seest, stand all aloof. Give me the light - Balthasar stands motionless - Romeo rips the torch from his hands and strides into the cemetery. Balthasar follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do beseech you... Romeo turns, punching Balthasar hard; he goes down, blood spurting from his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not interrupt me in my course or By heaven I will tear thee joint by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs! Balthasar slowly rises. Both boys are trying hard not to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) The time and my intents are savage wild, More fierce and more inexorable far Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will be gone and not trouble ye. Romeo smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So shalt thou show me friendship. They embrace as Romeo whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Live, and be prosperous; and farewell, good fellow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A crowbar wrenches at ornate glass and iron doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Gothic structure of the mausoleum rears against the night sky. Romeo frenziedly attacks the gates of the small side chapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death, Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open. With a final heave the doors scrape open. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : An endless marble corridor lit by hundreds of tiny flickering eternal flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Romeo. He murmurs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In despite I'll cram thee with more food. Suddenly a hurricane wind and whirr of machinery: like a huge black insect, Captain Prince's chopper swoops down over the mausoleum. Romeo is caught in the glare of the chopper's burning arc light. Sirens scream, police units race through the cemetery. Blinded, Romeo fires wildly toward the chopper. The police cars screech to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A police marksman in the chopper. His finger squeezes the rifle trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A bullet slams into Romeo's shoulder. The other cops open fire and Romeo is sent reeling backwards into the mausoleum in a fusillade of bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. An angry Captain Prince bellows into the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold! Hold! The police hold their fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Bleeding from the shoulder wound, Romeo drags shut the heavy double doors of the chapel. He bangs off three shots through a pane of broken glass and screams at the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand all aloof!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Outside the chopper hovers. Police take up siege positions. Captain Prince's voice echoes through the bullhorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo, come forth, come forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Romeo uses the crowbar to wedge the doors shut. He bangs off another shot as he yells out at the Police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tempt not a desperate man! Romeo waits. There is no response from the cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. As the chopper settles to earth, Captain Prince speaks into the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring forth these enemies Montague and Capulet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Orange rescue lights reflect through the windshield of the priest's car as it crawls past the crashed sedan and police vehicle. Father Laurence thumps the steering wheel in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saint Francis be my speed tonight! Across the road Police swarm around the entrance to the cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear comes upon me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: much I fear some ill unthrifty thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The green glow of the car clock as the seconds pulse away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Down the marble corridor lit by the eternal flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Romeo. He weakly stands at the entrance to the viewing chapel. The chapel is dark. As Romeo's eyes adjust he can just see, picked out by a shaft of blue moonlight, the glowing figure of a sleeping girl. He moves down the aisle past the tombs of long-dead Capulets. Romeo is close now. He halts as if in the presence of an unbelievable vision. He lights a match and the room glows gold. The warm light reveals a Juliet even more beautiful in seeming death. Romeo lights some of the hundreds of candles that surround her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O my love, my wife, Death, that hath sucked the honey of thy breath, Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty, Thou art not conquered. Beauty's ensign yet Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks, And death's pale flag is not advanced there. Romeo kneels close, as if not wanting to wake a sleeping child. Unconscious tears fall from his eyes as he whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Ah, dear Juliet, why art thou yet so fair? Shall I believe that unsubstantial
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is amorous and keeps thee here in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be his paramour? For fear of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still will stay with thee. Here, oh here Will I set up my everlasting rest And shake the yoke of inauspicious
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From this world-wearied flesh. He lays himself close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Eyes, look your last. Arms, take your last embrace. And, lips, O you The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss... Gently Romeo kisses Juliet's lips. Ever so slightly, Juliet's hand moves - Romeo does not notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A dateless bargain to engrossing death. Romeo drinks from the vial; the power of the compound is immediate. He convulses and falls, his head resting on Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (fighting for breath) O true apothecary, thy drugs are quick. Behind Romeo's head we can see Juliet's eyes opening. Romeo sucks the last few breaths of life into his lungs. Through a blurry consciousness Juliet becomes aware of Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Romeo, what's here? Forcing herself up, she cradles his head in her arms. Romeo's clear wide eyes stare back, he is completely still but for the sound of weak breaths desperately drawn across motionless lips. Juliet finds the vial clenched in Romeo's hand. Tears slip from her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Drunk all, and left No friendly drop to help me after. I will kiss thy lips. Haply some poison yet doth hang on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To make me die with a restorative. She delicately kisses Romeo's lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (a heart-broken whisper) Thy lips are warm. Desperately the lovers cling to each other. With all his desire to stay alive, Romeo whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thus with a kiss I die. There is no breath. He is still. Silence. Sobbing, Juliet hugs the lifeless Romeo to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo. O' my true love Romeo. She looks to the gun in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Quickly past Captain Prince and the Capulets taking cover behind a patrol car. Two police officers urgently convey Montague and his wife toward them. Discover Father Laurence arriving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Father Laurence's P.O.V.: Patrol cars, lights flashing, surround the mausoleum. He sees, through the open door of a police car, a hand- cuffed youth. It is Balthasar. Father Laurence hurries to him. It is dawning on Father Laurence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Balthasar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought news of Juliet's death... And then in post came Romeo from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To this same place... to this same monument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Father Laurence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long hath he been there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full half an hour. Father Laurence turns towards the mausoleum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romeo. (a shock of realisation) The lady stirs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Juliet: Sobbing uncontrollably she prises the gun from Romeo's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Father Laurence, desperate, breaks through the police line and runs toward the mausoleum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The parents and Captain Prince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold! Go not forth!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Juliet turns the gun on herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Father Laurence, he screams as he mounts the mausoleum stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lady stirs!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The sound of a single gun shot rips through the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Captain Prince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The parents, a look of cold shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The priest - his cry echoes through the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Juliet lies peacefully on Romeo's chest. Her eyes awake. A wash of deep red blood floods across them both. As we move away from the forms of the two young lovers lit by a ring of candles, the police burst in, guns ready to resolve what has already been resolved. Continuing up, we pass through the glass dome of the viewing chapel, and over the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. There, huddled at the base of the Mausoleum steps, are the Montague and Capulet parents and Father Laurence. From high up we see Captain Prince emerge from the Mausoleum and speak to the group. A moment, then their cries float gently up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. We are travelling high into the sky now. The cries of the parents and the buzz of radio calls fade to nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. As the sun struggled to rise, we push toward the figure of Jesus silently surveying the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN. As Jesus' face fills the screen, droplets of water begin to streak his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Music swells; the droplets grow to a torrent, and a heavy rain begins to fall. For a long beat, we stay with this image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN: From the Jesus. A sea of black umbrellas stretches back from the steps of Freedom Tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. At the top of the steps are a pair of flower strewn caskets. Before the caskets stand Fulgencia and Gloria Capulet, and Ted and Caroline Montague. They stare with blank, uncomprehending sorrow. Among the crowd we see the distraught faces of Benvolio, Balthasar, Father Laurence and the Nurse. The caskets are gently slid into a pair of long black cars. Montague and Capulet descend the stairs. Captain Prince blocks their path. He holds them in his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what a scourge is laid upon your hate, That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love; And I, for winking at your discords too, Have lost a brace of kinsmen. All are punished. The Prince steps aside. The procession moves off. Montague and Capulet look to one another, a moment, and then the two adversaries together follow the bodies of their dead children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The rain falls. Two black cars lead the people of Verona Beach in a sorrowful parade. As the cars pass beneath the towering effigy of Jesus, the image pixilates into a television picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A TV anchor woman watches the image on a studio monitor. She turns:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to camera) A glooming peace this morning with it brings: The sun for sorrow will not show his head. Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things. Some shall be pardoned, and some punished, For never was a story of more woe Than this of Juliet and her Romeo. The anchor woman changes beat to the next story; but her dialogue fades, and her image gets smaller as the television recedes into a black distance. The music that reminds us most of these two lost lives swells. When the television is very small it is switched off.
direction.name: direction
